main event: Seven bright white objects were observed in a vertical formation by a B-36 crew flying southwest of San Angelo, Texas on May 19, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were observed at an altitude of 18,000 feet for approximately 15-20 minutes,The objects appeared to be circular and were described as having the fuzzy, hazy appearance of dissipating vapor trails,Reports were made to San Angelo Radio, confirming sighting from the ground,The sighting included multiple crew members who each reported similar observations,Photographs were taken of the objects, though not all images in the report contained photographs.
sighted object: Seven bright circular objects in vertical formation
witness description: B-36 crew members, including pilots and navigators
